Dirichlet distribution

\begin{equation}
p(\{x_i\}|\{\alpha_i\}) = \frac{\Gamma(\mathrm{A})}{\prod_{i=1}^K \Gamma(\alpha_i)} \prod_{i=1}^K x_i^{\alpha_i - 1}
\end{equation}

with $\mathrm{A}=\sum_i \alpha_i$.

The log of the dirichlet function is then

\begin{equation}
\log p(\{x_i\}|\{\alpha_i\}) = \left(\log\Gamma(\mathrm{A}) - \sum_{i=1}^K \log\Gamma(\alpha_i)\right)
  \sum_{i=1}^K (\alpha_i - 1) \log(x_i)
\end{equation}
